Class AbandonedStation

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Cards.Card
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Cards.AbandonedStation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class AbandonedStation extends Card
Represents an Abandoned Station card in the game. This card has specific requirements that players must meet in order to board the station, and it awards a set of goods as a reward to the successful player. The card follows a sequence of player evaluations, interactions, and state transitions to determine the outcome of the card's effect.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • AbandonedStation

      public AbandonedStation(int requirement, ArrayList<Goods> reward, int level, int time, GameBoard board)
      Constructs a new AbandonedStation card with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      requirement - the minimum number of crew members needed to qualify
      reward - the list of goods awarded for boarding the station
      level - the difficulty level of the card
      time - the time cost associated with this card
      board - the game board this card is associated with

    • AbandonedStation

      public AbandonedStation()
      Empty constructor required for JSON serialization.

  • Method Details

    • sendTypeLog

      public void sendTypeLog()
      Sends type-specific log information to all players. Notifies all players that an Abandoned Station card has been encountered.
      Overrides:
      sendTypeLog in class Card

    • CardEffect

      public void CardEffect() throws InterruptedException
      Executes the main effect of the Abandoned Station card.

      Initializes the losers list, puts all players in waiting state, and begins the evaluation process after a brief delay to allow for proper state synchronization.

      Overrides:
      CardEffect in class Card
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted during the sleep period

    • updateStates

      public void updateStates()
      Updates player states and evaluates players in turn order.

      Iterates through players to find the first one who meets the crew requirement. The requirement includes human crew plus brown and purple aliens if present. When a qualified player is found, they are put in Accepting state.

      If no qualified player is found after checking all players, the card finishes automatically.

      Overrides:
      updateStates in class Card

    • finishCard

      public void finishCard()
      Finishes the card execution and performs cleanup.

      Calls the checkLosers method to handle any player elimination and marks the card as finished.

      Overrides:
      finishCard in class Card

    • continueCard

      public void continueCard(boolean accepted)
      Continues the execution of the Abandoned Station card based on the player's decision. If the player accepts to board the abandoned station, sends log messages to all players, grants rewards, updates the player's state to handle cargo, and moves the player on the board. If the player declines, updates the player's state to waiting, flags the card as incomplete, and proceeds to update the states for further processing.
      Overrides:
      continueCard in class Card
      Parameters:
      accepted - a boolean indicating whether the player accepted to board the station. If true, the player will proceed with rewards and cargo handling. If false, the player is put into a waiting state.

    • keepGoing

      public void keepGoing()
      Continues the process of executing the Abandoned Station card. Delegates to the finishCard method to complete the card's execution and perform necessary cleanup tasks. This method ensures that any required termination logic associated with the card is handled.
      Overrides:
      keepGoing in class Card

    • getRequirement

      public int getRequirement()
      Retrieves the crew requirement necessary to qualify for boarding the abandoned station.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the minimum number of crew members required

    • setRequirement

      public void setRequirement(int requirement)
